intro: Chromolaena tenuicapitulata, commonly known as the slender-headed chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
